item.title: Bitcoin bleeds for second straight day, nearly grazes $72,000
item.description: Bitcoin sank as low as $72,096.20 on Wednesday, marking its second consecutive day breaking below the $73,000 level.

item.title: Kalshi expands surveillance, enforcement efforts ahead of Super Bowl 60
item.description: Kalshi on Thursday announced new initiatives to expand its surveillance and enforcement frameworks, just days before the Super Bowl.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Qualcomm, Strategy, Align, Estee Lauder and more

item.title: Fixed-income ETF provider BondBloxx questions private credit meltdown fears, sees space as sensible way to generate income

item.title: Bitcoin briefly breaks below $73,000 to lowest since November 2024 as heavy selling resumes
item.description: Bitcoin fell below $73,000 on Tuesday as investors sold the asset to hedge against heightened geopolitical and economic uncertainties.
